title: Mark Allen gets earth-shattering news just weeks after he was told he'd beaten stage four cancer
text:
Popular radio presenter and former golfer Mark Allen was told he'd overcome stage four cancer earlier this year after getting a quarter of his lung and more than two-thirds of his rectum removed.

But today Allen's radio co-host David Schwarz revealed on Twitter that a new tumour was found on the Melbourne father-of-two's 'good lung'.

Allen learned of the shocking news on Tuesday - the same day it was announced that Macquarie Radio would be switched off air, reported the Herald Sun.

'Losing a job is tough, but it’s nothing when you’re fighting for your life,' Schwarz tweeted.

Radio presenter and former golfer Mark Allen (pictured left with his wife, Tricia) was told he'd overcome stage four cancer earlier this year

'My good mate Mark Allen got the bad news yesterday that his fight isn’t over just yet. Another tumour on his good lung this time. Wishing you all the best bud, you’re a fighter... you’ve got this.'

The news comes after the 50-year-old was deemed cancer-free in July this year.

The sports personality, who is married to wife Tricia, and is father to daughter Olivia, 12, and son Kelly, nine, underwent major surgery and endured intense radiology and chemotherapy.

While Allen remained optimistic throughout his treatment, the radio host previously admitted to the Herald Sun he had been questioning his own mortality when given the dual diagnosis.

Allen's (left) radio co-host David Schwarz (right) revealed on Twitter that a new tumour was found on the Melbourne father-of-two's 'good lung'

Along with losing large sections of his lung and rectum, Allen (pictured in hospital) had 40cm of his bowel removed

'In some of that alone time you are in the car and start thinking the worst,' he said.

'You are driving along and thinking about funeral songs. What song will they play at my funeral.'

Along with losing large sections of his lung and rectum, Allen had 40cm of his bowel removed.

The publication reported Allen had the initial lung tumour for more than three years before it was discovered.

Had he waited another 10 weeks to get it removed, the devoted dad would have died.

Fans took to Twitter to show their support and devastation.

Fans took to Twitter to show their support and devastation (pictured)

'Oh no. Thinking of you Mark. I know you'll keep fighting. We're all here for you, sending lots of love, strength and positive energy your way xox,' wrote one loyal fan.

'Get well Marko you got this,' said someone else.

Another devastated fan simply wrote 'Argh', with a sad emoji.

Allen played competitive golf for 15 years and was last ranked world number 177.
description: Popular Melbourne radio presenter Mark Allen was told he'd overcome stage four cancer earlier this year after getting a quarter of his lung and more than two-thirds of his rectum removed.
authors: Charlotte Karp For Daily Mail Australia
